intro: Micromeria boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or arid soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
